message: Sounds like a good time for a templatetag?

I'm curious of a clean way to solve the following problem:
- Populating navigation in base template based on a list of products
- All view functions must pass this to the template they render

Is there a cleaner, more django-ish way to solve this problem than making a wrapper view function that everyone calls to tack this on before rendering the template?
I guess another way is to request this via ajax on the page load then the ajax code can be only in the base template.  However, this seems like a bit of a hack.
(if I understand what you're after correctly)
@rob_ballou Thanks I'll look into the context processors.
@bmelton I guess I could just do the query in the tag code? Not a bad idea either.
@durden20 requestcontext is pretty useful regardless, so you might want to look into using it everywhere at some point
Template tag worked really well. I went against context processors because I'm using render_to_response and didn't want to modify all views to use requestcontext instead of context.  Thanks!
@pewpewarrows I'll definitely look at in the future.
